title: METALS-Copper drops from peak after mines unharmed by Chile's quake
content:
* Codelco, Antofagasta suspend some operations 
    
* Anglo American, BHP, KGHM say no impact from quake 
    
* Coming up: Federal Reserve rate decision at 1800 GMT

 (Adds details, quotes; previous MELBOURNE) 
    
By Eric Onstad 
    
LONDON, Sept 17 (Reuters) - Copper retreated from nearly two
month highs on Thursday as it appeared that an earthquake in top
producer Chile did little damage to mines. 
    
Base metals were down across the board as investors
refocused on concerns about demand in the biggest consumer China
and ahead of a decision on U.S. interest rates later in the day. 
    
Two copper operations in Chile were suspended as a
precaution, but there were no initial reports of damage to mines
following the 8.3 magnitude quake which killed eight people and
forced 1 million to flee their homes. 
    
"It caused a huge flurry of expectations but so far it
appears that there really hasn't been any damage," said Stephen
Briggs, metals strategist at BNP Paribas. 
    
"Copper hasn't been showing huge conviction recently because
there's still this worry about the demand side. Also, today's
not the day for taking big bets in either direction ahead of the
Fed decision this evening."
